channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2783] Congressman Paul Returns Over$100,000
item.description: Short, sweet and to the point. He walks the walk.

item.title: [+2424] "Unfair" Explained [GIF]
item.description: o_O

item.title: [+1874] Best Fails of 2009
item.description: The best falls, fails, blown saves, mistakes of 2009 all in one video.

item.title: [+1743] The Truth Behind the Stimulus Package (PIC)
item.description: Not sure if this is more funny or sad...but I had to chuckle.

item.title: [+1386] The kings of viral video are back with a brand new vid
item.description: OK GO, possibly best known for their treadmill video are back with one of the coolest videos I have seen in a while.This too shall pass, a la Rube Goldberg.PS, ok go are even greater live, go see em!

item.title: [+1123] ACORN Cleared Again, Video Doctored
item.description: Brooklyn prosecutors on Monday cleared ACORN of criminal wrongdoing after a four-month probe that began when undercover Republican "conservative" activists filmed workers giving what appeared to be illegal advice on how to hide money.

item.title: [+1117] Tea Party vs. Coffee Party
item.description: The Tea Party now has a challenger--for media attention, at least. A new organization called the Coffee Party is touting a pro-federal government, anti-obstructionist platform.

item.title: [+1102] Apple Files Against HTC For Infringing On 20 iPhone Patents
item.description: HTC is on Apple's firing line, with a lawsuit filed today claiming they infringed on 20 Apple patents. Sound familiar? Of course it does, because Nokia's being accused of the same thing.

item.title: [+1095] Man exercises free speech rights by giving cops the finger
item.description: His single-digit protests, aimed at Clackamas County sheriff's deputies last year, resulted in a verbal showdowns, traffic tickets and, ultimately, a federal lawsuit. Giving a police officer the finger may be a rude and ill-advised gesture, but it is not against the law, legal experts say.

item.title: [+801] Religious Nuts Say Slutty Clothes Provoke Rape
item.description: Some rape victims wouldn't have been raped if they had dressed properly, according to some religious nuts handing out pamphlets in Virginia. So basically if you dress like a tramp, you're asking for it; and leading good men away from Godliness by giving them impure thoughts.

item.title: [+796] GOPer's Filibuster Triggers Big Cuts in Medicare
item.description: Sen. Jim Bunning (R-KY) is already infamous for blocking a temporary extension of unemployment and COBRA benefits for out of work Americans. But included in that package is legislation to prevent a mandatory pay cut for doctors--and by standing in it's way, he's triggered a 21 percent fee reduction to doctors seeing Medicare patients starting today

item.title: [+785] Tons of Water Ice Found on the Moon's North Pole
item.description: Vast pockets of water ice numbering in the millions of tons have been discovered at the north pole of the moon.

item.title: [+758] The World's Largest Amateur Rocket
item.description: Unlike wood-based models, the Heat 1X is a real metal rocket. At more than 9 meters high, it's also the largest amateur rocket in the world. The guys building it are planning one almost as large as the V-2.

item.title: [+750] 15 Must-Have Free Apps For Your Mac
item.description: We ask ourselves the golden question, “Is this app a keeper?” That’s what this list is all about — those apps that eventually find a permanent place on our Macs to call Home. Everyone should have these installed, regardless of what you use your Mac for.

item.title: [+714] Republicans Setting Filibuster Record
item.description: The filibuster – tool of obstruction in the U.S. Senate – is alternately blamed and praised for wilting President Barack Obama's ambitious agenda. Some even say it's made the nation ungovernable.

item.title: [+699] Comcast: 'Unlimited Usage' Doesn't Mean 'Unlimited Usage'
item.description: In January, Consumerist reader Matt received a brochure from Comcast touting their high-speed Internet service with "Unlimited usage for a flat, monthly rate." But only one month after upgrading to Comcast's "Ultra Tier," he found out that, well... "unlimited" actually means "limited."

item.title: [+653] Chilean Quake Likely Shifted Earth's Axis
item.description: The earthquake that killed more than 700 people in Chile on Feb. 27 probably shifted the Earth's axis and shortened the day, a National Aeronautics and Space Administration scientist said.

item.title: [+646] Equality? (PIC)
item.description: With both men and women competing on the world stage in Vancouver for the 2010 Olympic Games, most will tell you that over these two weeks of competition

item.title: [+617] Cyberwar Hype Intended to Destroy the Open Internet
item.description: The biggest threat to the open internet is not Chinese hackers or greedy anti-net neutrality ISPs, it's Michael McConnell, former director of national intelligence. McConnell is the nice-seeming guy who is willing and able to use fear-mongering to manipulate the federal bureaucracy for his own ends, And now he says we need to re-engineer the 'net.

item.title: [+601] Porsche Unveils Plug-In, Gets 78 MPG and 0-60 in 3.2 Seconds
item.description: The 918 Spyder is powered by both a 500-horsepower V8 and a pair of electric motors (one for each axle) producing an additional 218 horsepower or 160kW. At full gallop, the concept can theoretically reach 62 miles per hour in 3.2 seconds and nip 198 mph on the high end.
